div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, May 15, [1940]

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
May 15

div1.p:
You must have been puz-
zled at my letter- I read
yours of the 7th rather hastity
and though it was on the 14th
or 15th of this month that you
would be in Washington-

Now has come your note of the
13th showing that you understood
my error- Well the room at the
Army & Navy Club will be at
your disposal when you want it
and I will be happy to see you-
You said in a former letter that
you would send me a brief
questionnaire so I could look up
HC
K
the points of interest to you in
my data- which are scattered
through my papers-

I have a letter also from Mr. Harry
Clemons, librarian Alderman Library
and I will today answer it to
say that I have deposited the manu-
scripts of the Walter Reed & Yellow Fever
episode there for the use of such
researchers as yourself and will be
glad to have copies furnished to you

I think I will also lend you two
papers I have at hand- The address
at the dedication of the birthplace of
Walter Reed and my review of
the life of Gen. Gorgas by Burton J.
Hendrick & Mrs. Gorgas- that is if you
have not seen them- They convey facts
not mentioned elsewhere- The latter
is on file at the Alderman Library-
